Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Driver

  •  class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    The Driver for the robot, it instantiates the robot(type Swagbot) gets the bluetooth values and calles localise(), waits for idle and then findBlocks() The public static void main(String args[]) method which interfaces with the Bluetooth server and instantiates the robot.Also contains helper methods and test methods.

    Author:
    Alex

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void followPath(java.util.ArrayList<ISearchNode> path)
      Robot will follow the input path.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      the entry-point where we create our robot
      private static void monitorForExit()
      The robot creates a thread to continually monitor the escape button and allow for exiting the program at any point in the code after this method is invoked.
      static void runAbridgedTests()
      quick test -- turns left 30 degrees and back, spin/travels to -5,-5 and returns
      static void runTests()
      unit tests for robot code, localise: working correctly | desired function: rotates counterclockwise and updates odometer turnTo/travelTo: works | desired function: turn left, turn right travel to the first cross of vertical and horizontal lines face 90 (straight).
      static void transform()
      The robot localises at (30.48,30.48) in our coordinate system with the origin at the edge of the field regardless of the corner it is placed in.The points passed to the robot through bluetooth are transformed to our coordinate system taking into account the corner the robot is placed in.
      static void travelWithAStar(int x, int y)
      Robot will travel to coordinates using AStar.
      static void waitForIdle()
      Wait for the robot's status to be idle (eg completed a turn, or travelled to a destination).Using this after a command such as turnTo or findBlocks allows the program to wait for the method to execute.
      static void waitForSubTask()
      Waits for the robot subtask to finish and return to finding or become idle.

      • followPath

        public static void followPath(java.util.ArrayList<ISearchNode> path)
        Robot will follow the input path.

      • transform

        public static void transform()
        The robot localises at (30.48,30.48) in our coordinate system with the origin at the edge of the field regardless of the corner it is placed in.The points passed to the robot through bluetooth are transformed to our coordinate system taking into account the corner the robot is placed in.

      • monitorForExit

        private static void monitorForExit()
        The robot creates a thread to continually monitor the escape button and allow for exiting the program at any point in the code after this method is invoked.

      • waitForIdle

        public static void waitForIdle()
        Wait for the robot's status to be idle (eg completed a turn, or travelled to a destination).Using this after a command such as turnTo or findBlocks allows the program to wait for the method to execute.

      • runTests

        public static void runTests()
        unit tests for robot code, localise: working correctly | desired function: rotates counterclockwise and updates odometer turnTo/travelTo: works | desired function: turn left, turn right travel to the first cross of vertical and horizontal lines face 90 (straight). findBlocks: working correctly | not tested, too long when you complete a function write a test method say what it's supposed to do and run it here, then test to make sure everything functions properly.

      • runAbridgedTests

        public static void runAbridgedTests()
        quick test -- turns left 30 degrees and back, spin/travels to -5,-5 and returns
